data: Flux is a modern, native macOS media center built with SwiftUI. It allows you to browse, manage, and play movies and TV shows with a premium "Glass" aesthetic.
data.why-flux#Why Flux?:
Native Experience: Unlike Electron apps, Flux feels like it belongs on your Mac.
Performance: Built with Swift and MPV for buttery smooth playback of 4K HDR content.
Privacy: Open source and transparent. No tracking.
data.community#Community: Join the discussion on GitHub Discussions or contribute to the project!

data.setup-steps#Setup Steps:
Clone the Repository
git clone https://github.com/zainulnazir/flux.git
cd flux
Configure SecretsFlux uses TMDB API and Firebase, which require keys.
Copy flux/flux/Services/SecretsExample.txt to flux/flux/Services/Secrets.swift.
Add your TMDB API Key.
Firebase Setup
Create a Firebase Project.
Download GoogleService-Info.plist.
Place it in flux/flux/.
Build and RunOpen flux/flux.xcodeproj in Xcode and press Run (Cmd+R).
